newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka forex market flat on low dlr demand.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka forex market flat on low dlr demand.

text.p: The Sri Lankan rupee was unchanged against the dollar in early Wednesday trade due to low demand for the greenback, dealers said.
At 0450 GMT the rupee was at its opening level of 58.49 to the dollar. The rupee closed at the same level on Tuesday.
"There is very little demand for dollars. The market is also well offered and can easily fill normal demand for it (dollars)," said an American Express Bank dealer.
The Central Bank pushed up the dollar by three-quarter local cents, fixing buying and selling prices at 58.4843 and 59.6658.
Overnight call money was also well offered, with the rate at 9.5 percent despite a big state bank borrowing, dealers said.
